intro: Helmia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited helmiace, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. Helmia brachycarpa is often found in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
